page.title: 20INTERVIEW _ RECTOR
page.content: {The Rector}was ordained five years ago. He lives in the vicarage at Dean; he serves six churches and is assisted by a part-time deaconess. His aim is to maintain a modern approach to religion in order to attract more young people to his congregation. There are 210 parishoners and 60 regular church goers. The majority of young people still marry in the church. There is a Sunday School and Club for the younger children and a family service is held each month. The Rector said he hoped to raise cash to buy a mini-bus in order to transport the teenagers on outings. The form of service adopted in the Church is the Ancient and Modern New Standard with the Common Prayer.
